alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Dubois, northwestern Crawford and northwestern Perry Counties through 730 PM EDT/630 PM CDT/... At 652 PM EDT/552 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Tell City, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Crawford, northwestern Perry and eastern Dubois Counties, including the following locations... Riceville, Ranger, Sassafras, Bristow, Celina, Terry, West Fork, Eckerty, Mifflin and Saint Croix. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
